conclusion: Analyze processes in the p-V diagram to determine heat absorbed vs. released.
Cycle consists of two adiabatic and two isochoric processes.
Adiabatic processes: no heat exchange, work done changes internal energy.
Isochoric processes: constant volume, work done is zero, heat exchange changes internal energy.
Process ab: adiabatic expansion from state a to b.
Process bc: isochoric heating from state b to c.
Process cd: adiabatic compression from state c to d.
Process da: isochoric cooling from state d to a.
Process ab: Q = 0, gas does work, internal energy decreases.
Process bc: no work done, heat added increases internal energy.
Process cd: Q = 0, surroundings do work, internal energy increases.
Process da: no work done, heat released decreases internal energy.
Net heat exchange: heat absorbed in bc, heat released in da.
Net heat is difference between heat absorbed in bc and released in da.
Net change in internal energy over cycle is zero, net work equals net heat absorbed.
For net work-producing cycle, heat absorbed in bc must be greater than heat released in da.
Heat absorbed is greater than heat released.
